Simply put, this program reflects our values – all Americans deserve to retire with dignity. 

To the Alaskans back home who are scared of losing their Social Security benefits, know that I hear your concerns and I am bringing them to light in DC. #MaryInCongress

I was raised, as I think many others were, to value and treat our elders with great deference and respect to care for them as they have cared for us. What better way to do that than to make sure they have a safe and secure retirement?
In fact, a report showed that without Social Security, the poverty rate in Alaska would have increased from 7.6 percent to 28 percent.

Now, let’s take a look at Alaska. In 2021, Social Security helped 110,000 Alaskans stay out of poverty, including 84,796 folks who were 65 and older – that’s over 13 percent of Alaska’s residents in total.
Today, Social Security provides monthly checks to more than 65 million beneficiaries who depend on it for food and other necessities.

With the enactment of the Social Security Act in 1935, our nation made a promise to take care of retired, disabled, and widowed Americans in return for working hard and contributing to the program to support others.
